title: Shock Le Pen verdict rocks French far right

title: Sources: Miles to forgo WNBA draft, enter portal
snippets: Following her team's exit in the Sweet 16 on Saturday, Notre Dame guard Olivia Miles has decided forgo the WNBA draft, despite being the projected as the No. 2 overall selection, and enter the transfer portal, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania on Monday.
summary: Notre Dame guard Olivia Miles, projected as the No. 2 overall selection for the WNBA draft, has chosen to enter the transfer portal instead of joining the WNBA, following her team's Sweet 16 exit. This decision was reported by ESPN's Shams Charania.
titles: Sources: Miles to forgo WNBA draft, enter portal

titles: Braves' Profar gets 80-game ban for PED violation

title: New AI models possible game-changers within protein science and healthcare
snippets: Researchers have developed new AI models that can vastly improve accuracy and discovery within protein science. Potentially, the models will assist the medical sciences in overcoming present challenges within, e.g. personalised medicine, drug discovery, and diagnostics.
summary: Researchers have created new AI models aimed at enhancing protein science, with the potential to significantly advance medical fields such as personalized medicine, drug discovery, and diagnostics. These models are designed to improve accuracy and facilitate new discoveries.
titles: New AI models possible game-changers within protein science and healthcare

title: Delicate balancing act determines how many genome gateways form in cells
snippets: As warehouses go, nuclei are more like libraries than bank vaults. Too many cellular components need access to the genome to lock it down like Fort Knox. Instead, large groupings of more than 1,000 individual protein molecules called nuclear pore complexes (NPCs) pepper the dividing membrane, serving as gateways for materials and messages entering and exiting the nucleus. While the basic need for this shuttle service is constant, scientists have shown that cells dynamically adjust their amounts of NPCs like a retail store opening more or fewer checkout lines throughout the day. Scientists now reveal the results of screening the entire human genome to find factors influencing how many NPCs are assembled.
summary: Scientists have discovered that cells regulate the number of nuclear pore complexes (NPCs), which are groups of over 1,000 protein molecules acting as gateways for materials entering and exiting the nucleus, similar to how a retail store adjusts its checkout lines. This regulation is crucial for the constant exchange of substances needed by the nucleus. Through screening the entire human genome, researchers identified factors that influence the assembly of NPCs, highlighting the dynamic nature of cellular function.
titles: Delicate balancing act determines how many genome gateways form in cells

title: Change in oxygen standards for trauma patients?
snippets: A recent study finds most critically injured patients can recover with less supplemental oxygen than has previously been suggested.
summary: A recent study has shown that critically injured patients can successfully recover using lower levels of supplemental oxygen than previously recommended.
titles: Change in oxygen standards for trauma patients?

title: New study links lower proportions of certain sleep stages to brain changes associated with Alzheimer's disease
snippets: New research reveals that lower proportions of specific sleep stages are associated with reduced brain volume in regions vulnerable to the development of Alzheimer's disease over time.
summary: Recent research has found that decreased amounts of certain sleep stages are linked to a decrease in brain volume in areas susceptible to Alzheimer's disease progression.
titles: New study links lower proportions of certain sleep stages to brain changes associated with Alzheimer's disease

title: Machine learning model to predict virus reservoirs
snippets: A new artificial intelligence tool could aid in limiting or even prevent pandemics by identifying animal species that may harbor and spread viruses capable of infecting humans. The machine learning model analyzes host characteristics and virus genetics to identify potential animal reservoirs and geographic areas where new outbreaks are more likely to occur.
summary: A new AI tool has been developed to help prevent pandemics by identifying animals that could spread viruses to humans. It uses machine learning to analyze animal traits and virus genetics, pinpointing potential reservoirs and areas at higher risk for outbreaks.
titles: Machine learning model to predict virus reservoirs
